lead_paragraph: COOPERSMITH--Dr. Sy, psychoanalyst, died peacefully at home of respiratory arrest on November 6, 2015. He was 84. Sy was born on June 19, 1931 and grew up in Boston. He graduated from Boston Latin High School, Bates College and earned his doctorate at Columbia University Teachers College. Sy did his psychoanalytic training at the National Psychological Association for Psychoanalysis where he also served on the faculty and was a senior clinical supervisor. He is survived by his wife Dr. Valerie Pinhas, and daughter Andie Coopersmith. A Memorial Service will be held at NPAP on January 10, 2016 from 1-3pm, 40 West 13th St., NY, NY 10011. 1/3
